sourceMeaningMnemonic: A <radical>tsunami</radical> goes through a little <radical>door</radical>, and plops down a <radical>big</radical> drop on your face. This tsunami is your tears inside your eye area. The door is your tear duct. The big drop is the <kanji>teardrop</kanji> coming down your eye.
meaningInfo: Imagine a teardrop going through this process to get out of your eye, though in a more miniature teardrop size.
readingMnemonic: Your <kanji>teardrop</kanji>s always come at the worst times, <reading>rui</reading>ning (<ja>るい</ja>) serious and/or happy moments. You can't stop crying. It is ruining your life!
readingInfo: Think of several inappropriate situations to cry in. Put yourself in them. Think about how all this crying is ruining things, for real!
